rows.Title: CP Crash observed during CP stress test
rows.Problem: Turn ON the Phone > Run CP stress script > Observe. Actual Result: Kernel Panic Observed. Expected result: CP Crash should not be observed.
rows.Summarized Problem: CP crash occurs during stress test, causing kernel panic.
rows.Severity Reason: CP crash leads to kernel panic, halting system operation.

rows.Title: CP Crash observed during CP stress test
rows.Problem:
Pre condition : SIM1: Airtel
                   DUT: SM-F761BE_SWA [352845440000562]
                   S/W version: AYD3/AYD3/AYD3

CP Stress Script name: CP Stress script 2025_03

Occurrence process:
Turn ON the Phone > Run CP stress script > Observe

Actual Result:
CP Crash Observed.
[ 1943.124899] [6: cbd: 1098] Kernel panic - not syncing: CP Crash : CP Crash by CP - UMTS: N/A
[ 1943.124899] [6: cbd: 1098] D-Abort(L3OT):DomainFault


Expected result: 
CP Crash should not be observed.

Note:
RDX, Dumpstate, Act logs attached.
rows.Summarized Problem: CP crash occurs during stress test, causing kernel panic and domain fault.
rows.Severity Reason: CP crash causes kernel panic and system failure during operation.

rows.Title: VoNR toggle button is not showing in Network menu for Jio/Airtel.
rows.Problem: Go to settings > Connections > Mobile Network > Observe. VoNR toggle button is not available for Jio or Airtel. Expected result: VoNR toggle button should be available under Network menu.
rows.Summarized Problem: VoNR toggle button is missing in Network menu for Jio and Airtel.
rows.Severity Reason: Feature missing prevents users from enabling VoNR on supported networks.

rows.Title: Data icon shows 4G while Device upper layer Indicator set 1
rows.Problem: Access data using SIM1, keep device idle until 4G data icon displays. Dial *#0011# to observe. Data icon shows 4G while Device upper layer Indicator is set to 1. Expected: UpperLayer Indicator 1 should show 5G Hollow when data not in use.
rows.Summarized Problem: Data icon shows 4G when upper layer indicator is set to 1, contradicting expected 5G Hollow display for data not in use.
rows.Severity Reason: Always occurs, contradicts expected behavior, affects data state visibility and user trust.

rows.Title: Unable to retrive the Call screen from Notification panel
rows.Problem: Make MO/MT Call > tap in Home button > tap on the Call screen icon from top right corner > Unable to retrive the Call screen from Notification panel. Expected result: Call screen should get retrieved when tap on the Call icon.
rows.Summarized Problem: Call screen cannot be retrieved from notification panel when tapping the icon.
rows.Severity Reason: Issue occurs always under precondition and blocks call screen access.

rows.Title: System UI ANR occur
rows.Problem: Idle > drag Quick Plane > expand > edit icon > observe. Actual Result: SystemUI ANR occur. Expected result: Quick planel should work properly without any error
rows.Summarized Problem: System UI experiences ANR during Quick Plane interaction
rows.Severity Reason: ANR occurs during normal usage, affects feature functionality

rows.Title: Unable to turn on JIO Esim
rows.Problem: Pre condition : DUT: SM-F761BE_SWA [352845440001230] S/W version: AYD3/AYD3/AYD3 Occurrence process: Idle > Add JIO esim > esim configured > settings > SIM manager > Esim ON > Turn on eSIM > select "Turn ON" > Observe Actual Result: "Couldn't connect with SIM. Try again later" pop up occur when we turn on Esim Expected result: Esim should be configured and work properly without any error.
rows.Summarized Problem: User cannot turn on JIO eSIM, receives 'Couldn't connect with SIM' error.
rows.Severity Reason: Always occurs during eSIM setup, blocks functional use of eSIM.

rows.Title: Wifi auto delatch & re-latch observed
rows.Problem: Connect DUT1 to DUT2 hotspot, enable Wifi Calling, keep device idle. Sometimes, Wifi auto delatches and re-latches. Expected: no auto delatch.
rows.Summarized Problem: Wifi auto delatch and re-latch occurs during idle state, violating expected behavior.
rows.Severity Reason: Occurs intermittently during normal usage, affects call stability.

rows.Title: DUT remains in Emergency Calls only state post Panic Call
rows.Problem: Make a Panic Call by pressing power button 3 times > wait > observe. Do Flight MODE ON/OFF > observe. DUT unable to connect to Emergency Number. During call establish, DUT falls back to 2G and then Emergency Call only state. DUT stays in Emergency Call screen for long time. After terminate call, DUT unable to re-latch to NW. DUT latches to NW post Flight mode ON/OFF. Expected: DUT should connect to Emergency number. Should not stay in Emergency Call screen. Should latch to NW post Emergency call ends.
rows.Summarized Problem: Device fails to connect to emergency number and remains in emergency call state after panic call.
rows.Severity Reason: Device fails to establish emergency call and cannot re-connect to network after call ends, affecting core functionality.

rows.Title: DUT fall back to 2G NW when receive the MT Call
rows.Problem: Precondition: SIM1: Airtel [DUT1], SIM1: Airtel [DUT2], Both DUTs must connect to a Hotspot, VoWifi must be enabled (with Wi-Fi preferred). Occurrence process: 1. Make MT Call (VoLTE/ViLTE) to DUT1 from DUT2 > Observe. Occurrence status: 1. DUT1 takes more time to get the Call. 2. DUT1 gets CSFB to 2G NW when get the MT Call. 3. Everything works fine when Wi-Fi is in OFF state. Expected result: 1. DUT should get the MT Call on Wi-Fi and VoWifi/ViWifi Call should establish without CSFB.
rows.Summarized Problem: DUT falls back to 2G network during MT VoLTE call when VoWifi is enabled.
rows.Severity Reason: Issue occurs during active call, blocks VoLTE functionality under Wi-Fi preference.
